clusters.title: Arrests made in crown jewelry heist at Paris' Louvre museum, prosecutor says
clusters.neutral_headline: Suspects Arrested in Louvre Museum Crown Jewel Heist
bullet_summary: Suspects have been arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world
The prosecutor said that investigators made the arrests on Saturday evening, adding that one of the men taken into custody was preparing to leave the country from Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport
The Paris prosecutor said on Sunday that a number of suspects have been arrested over the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre museum in Paris last weekend
French police have made arrests in connection with the heist of France’s crown jewels from the Louvre Museum in Paris, officials said Sunday

items.title: Arrests made in crown jewelry heist at Paris' Louvre museum, prosecutor says
items.standfirst: Thieves took less than eight minutes to steal jewels valued at $102 million last Sunday morning from Paris' famous Louvre museum.
items.content: Thieves took less than eight minutes to steal jewels valued at $102 million last Sunday morning from Paris' famous Louvre museum.

items.title: French police arrest suspects linked to Louvre jewellery heist
items.standfirst: Suspects have been arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world. The prosecutor said that investigators made the arrests on Saturday evening, adding that one of the men taken into custody was preparing to leave the country from Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.
items.content: Suspects have been arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world. The prosecutor said that investigators made the arrests on Saturday evening, adding that one of the men taken into custody was preparing to leave the country from Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.

items.title: Suspects arrested over theft of crown jewels from the Louvre, prosecutor says
items.standfirst: Suspects have been arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world.
items.content: Suspects have been arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre museum, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday, a week after the heist that stunned the world.

items.title: French police arrest two men over €88m Louvre jewel heist
items.standfirst: One man arrested at Charles de Gaulle airport and another just outside Paris, officials confirm French police have arrested two suspects believed to have helped steal crown jewels worth an estimated €88m (£76m) from the Louvre museum in Paris, officials have said, a week after one of the country’s most spectacular heists in decades.The Paris public prosecutor confirmed media reports on Sunday that one man had been detained at about 10pm (8pm UK time) on Saturday at the capital’s Charles de Gaulle airport by officers from the armed robberies and serious burglaries squad. Continue reading...
items.content: One man arrested at Charles de Gaulle airport and another just outside Paris, officials confirm French police have arrested two suspects believed to have helped steal crown jewels worth an estimated €88m (£76m) from the Louvre museum in Paris, officials have said, a week after one of the country’s most spectacular heists in decades.The Paris public prosecutor confirmed media reports on Sunday that one man had been detained at about 10pm (8pm UK time) on Saturday at the capital’s Charles de Gaulle airport by officers from the armed robberies and serious burglaries squad. Continue reading...

items.title: Two arrested over theft of jewels at Louvre museum in Paris
items.standfirst: Four thieves broke into the world's most-visited museum in broad daylight, stealing eight items worth €88m (£76m; $102m).
items.content: Four thieves broke into the world's most-visited museum in broad daylight, stealing eight items worth €88m (£76m; $102m).

items.title: Louvre heist suspects reportedly arrested in northern Paris suburb
items.standfirst: Two suspects have been arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre Museum, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday, a week after the heist at the world’s most visited museum that stunned the world. Citing local media, FRANCE 24’s Ellen Gainsford reported that the arrests took place in Saint-Denis, a northern suburb of Paris, and that one of the men was attempting to travel to Algeria from Charles de Gaulle Airport.
items.content: Two suspects have been arrested in connection with the theft of crown jewels from Paris’ Louvre Museum, the Paris prosecutor said on Sunday, a week after the heist at the world’s most visited museum that stunned the world. Citing local media, FRANCE 24’s Ellen Gainsford reported that the arrests took place in Saint-Denis, a northern suburb of Paris, and that one of the men was attempting to travel to Algeria from Charles de Gaulle Airport.

items.title: French police make first arrests in €88mn Louvre heist
items.standfirst: One of the alleged burglars was trying to leave the country from Charles de Gaulle airport
items.content: One of the alleged burglars was trying to leave the country from Charles de Gaulle airport

items.title: Two suspects arrested in Louvre jewellery heist
items.standfirst: Two men have been detained by police, suspected of being part of the four-man team that stole some of France's most precious jewellery from the Louvre Museum last Sunday.
items.content: Two men have been detained by police, suspected of being part of the four-man team that stole some of France's most precious jewellery from the Louvre Museum last Sunday.

items.title: Suspects arrested over the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre museum in Paris
items.standfirst: The Paris prosecutor said on Sunday that a number of suspects have been arrested over the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre museum in Paris last weekend.
items.content: The Paris prosecutor said on Sunday that a number of suspects have been arrested over the theft of crown jewels from the Louvre museum in Paris last weekend.(Image credit: AP)

items.title: Two suspects arrested in Louvre museum jewellery heist
items.standfirst: Two men have been detained by police, suspected of being part of the four-man team that stole some of France's most precious jewellery from the Louvre Museum last Sunday.
items.content: Two men have been detained by police, suspected of being part of the four-man team that stole some of France's most precious jewellery from the Louvre Museum last Sunday.

items.title: Arrests made in Louvre jewel heist, French prosecutors say
items.standfirst: French police have made arrests in connection with the heist of France’s crown jewels from the Louvre Museum in Paris, officials said Sunday
items.content: French police have made arrests in connection with the heist of France’s crown jewels from the Louvre Museum in Paris, officials said Sunday

items.title: Arrests made in Louvre jewellery heist by French police: Paris prosecutor
items.standfirst: Prosecutor confirms the arrests of suspects, including one detained while about to board a flight abroad.
items.content: Prosecutor confirms the arrests of suspects, including one detained while about to board a flight abroad.

items.title: Prosecutor furious as news leaks of Louvre heist gang arrests
items.standfirst: Two men have been arrested following a robbery at the Louvre museum in Paris which saw thieves escape with priceless jewellery, including part of the French crown jewels.
items.content: Two men have been arrested following a robbery at the Louvre museum in Paris which saw thieves escape with priceless jewellery, including part of the French crown jewels.

ai_summary: French police arrested suspects connected to the Louvre Museum jewel theft.
The Paris prosecutor confirmed arrests made on Saturday evening.
One suspect was reportedly preparing to leave from Charles de Gaulle Airport.
The stolen jewels are valued at approximately $102 million.
The heist occurred in less than eight minutes at the Louvre Museum.

clusters.title: Trump kicks off Asia tour with Xi meeting on the agenda
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Begins Asia Tour, Oversees Thailand-Cambodia Ceasefire
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, BBC World, Al Jazeera and others

items.title: Trump kicks off Asia tour with Xi meeting on the agenda
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump started his Asia tour in Malaysia Sunday by rewarding Cambodia and Thailand with trade deals after co-signing their ceasefire pact, and saying he was confident of a "great" trade deal at upcoming talks with China's Xi Jinping. Trump brimmed with confidence ahead of the meeting with Xi in South Korea, that seeks to end the bruising trade war between the world's two biggest economies.
items.content: US President Donald Trump started his Asia tour in Malaysia Sunday by rewarding Cambodia and Thailand with trade deals after co-signing their ceasefire pact, and saying he was confident of a "great" trade deal at upcoming talks with China's Xi Jinping. Trump brimmed with confidence ahead of the meeting with Xi in South Korea, that seeks to end the bruising trade war between the world's two biggest economies.

items.title: Will Trump's 'peace deal' solve Thailand-Cambodia dispute?
items.standfirst: Donald Trump has claimed to have ended another war, this time between Thailand and Cambodia. But what does this latest agreement actually amount to?
items.content: Donald Trump has claimed to have ended another war, this time between Thailand and Cambodia. But what does this latest agreement actually amount to?

items.title: Anti-Trump rally held in Malaysia over Gaza war
items.standfirst: Hundreds of pro-Palestinian protesters rallied in the Malaysian capital against the visit of US President Donald Trump.
items.content: Hundreds of pro-Palestinian protesters rallied in the Malaysian capital against the visit of US President Donald Trump.

items.title: Trump oversees Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire signing as Asia tour gets under way
items.standfirst: Trump has begun a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in JanuaryDonald Trump has overseen the signing of a ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia on the first day of an Asia tour where he will seal new trade agreements and hold a crucial meeting with Xi Jinping.The US president arrived in Malaysia on Sunday before the Asean summit in the capital, Kuala Lumpur. At a ceasefire ceremony in front of a sign that read “Delivering Peace”, the Thai prime minister, Anutin Charnvirakul, and his Cambodian counterpart, Hun Manet, signed an expanded ceasefire deal related to a deadly five-day conflict in July. Continue reading...
items.content: Trump has begun a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in JanuaryDonald Trump has overseen the signing of a ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia on the first day of an Asia tour where he will seal new trade agreements and hold a crucial meeting with Xi Jinping.The US president arrived in Malaysia on Sunday before the Asean summit in the capital, Kuala Lumpur. At a ceasefire ceremony in front of a sign that read “Delivering Peace”, the Thai prime minister, Anutin Charnvirakul, and his Cambodian counterpart, Hun Manet, signed an expanded ceasefire deal related to a deadly five-day conflict in July. Continue reading...

items.content: Hundreds gather to express opposition to US president's attendance at ASEAN summit in Kuala Lumpur.

items.content: The leaders of Thailand and Cambodia have expanded a ceasefire deal in the presence of US President Donald Trump.

items.content: US President Donald Trump in Malaysia: Dancing and a 'peace deal'

items.title: Trump presides over Thai-Cambodia 'peace deal' - but what does it mean?
items.standfirst: Trump calls it historic, Thailand only calls is "a pathway to peace", but all sides hope the agreement will stick.
items.content: Trump calls it historic, Thailand only calls is "a pathway to peace", but all sides hope the agreement will stick.

items.title: Trump touts his peacemaking skills as Thailand and Cambodia sign ceasefire deal
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump kicked off his trip to Asia on Sunday by presiding over the signing of an enhanced ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia that he helped mediate earlier this year.
items.content: President Donald Trump kicked off his trip to Asia on Sunday by presiding over the signing of an enhanced ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia that he helped mediate earlier this year.

items.title: Trump says he's ended eight wars in eight months
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump has claimed he is now responsible for bringing to an end eight wars, as he visited Malaysia to oversee the signing of an expanded ceasefire deal between Thailand and Cambodia.
items.content: US President Donald Trump has claimed he is now responsible for bringing to an end eight wars, as he visited Malaysia to oversee the signing of an expanded ceasefire deal between Thailand and Cambodia.

items.title: Trump arrives in Asia with trade — and tensions with Xi — on the agenda
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump arrived in Southeast Asia on Sunday for his first visit to the continent since returning to office, a three-nation tour through Malaysia, Japan and South Korea that is expected to culminate in a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as tensions between the world’s two biggest economies tick higher.
items.content: President Donald Trump arrived in Southeast Asia on Sunday for his first visit to the continent since returning to office, a three-nation tour through Malaysia, Japan and South Korea that is expected to culminate in a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping, as tensions between the world’s two biggest economies tick higher.

items.title: Trump says he is open to meeting Kim Jong-un as he embarks on whirlwind Asia tour
items.standfirst: Trip will see him take part in high-stakes trade talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping – but he also raised prospect of meeting North Korean leaderTrump in Asia: five key questions as US president prepares for diplomatic tourDonald Trump has set off for a tour of Asia where he is expected to take part in high-stakes trade talks with China’s leader, Xi Jinping – telling reporters he was also open to a meeting with the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un.Trump, who left Washington on Friday night, is set for a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in January. He is due to arrive in Malaysia on Sunday morning local time. Continue reading...
items.content: Trip will see him take part in high-stakes trade talks with Chinese leader Xi Jinping – but he also raised prospect of meeting North Korean leaderTrump in Asia: five key questions as US president prepares for diplomatic tourDonald Trump has set off for a tour of Asia where he is expected to take part in high-stakes trade talks with China’s leader, Xi Jinping – telling reporters he was also open to a meeting with the North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un.Trump, who left Washington on Friday night, is set for a five-day trip to Malaysia, Japan and South Korea, his first visit to the region since taking office in January. He is due to arrive in Malaysia on Sunday morning local time. Continue reading...

ai_summary: President Trump began his Asia tour in Malaysia on Sunday.
He oversaw the signing of a ceasefire agreement between Thailand and Cambodia.
Trump is scheduled to meet with China's Xi Jinping during the tour.
Hundreds protested Trump's visit in Malaysia over the war in Gaza.
Trump rewarded Cambodia and Thailand with trade deals.

items.title: 10/26: Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan
items.standfirst: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan, amid President Trump and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's trip to Asia, Bessent joins to discuss the Chinese tariffs, the TikTok deal and the government shutdown at home. Plus. House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries joins to discuss the government shutdown.
items.content: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan, amid President Trump and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's trip to Asia, Bessent joins to discuss the Chinese tariffs, the TikTok deal and the government shutdown at home. Plus. House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries joins to discuss the government shutdown.

items.title: Rep. John Moolenaar says freeing the TikTok algorithm from China will be "up to the experts"
items.standfirst: Republican Rep. John Moolenaar, who is the chairman of the House select committee on the Chinese Communist Party, told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that with the TikTok deal set to be finalized this week that will require divestment of Chinese control of the algorithm, "how you get that algorithm completely out of Chinese control is up to the experts."
items.content: Republican Rep. John Moolenaar, who is the chairman of the House select committee on the Chinese Communist Party, told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that with the TikTok deal set to be finalized this week that will require divestment of Chinese control of the algorithm, "how you get that algorithm completely out of Chinese control is up to the experts."

items.title: Scott Bessent says he's 'felt this pain' from China because 'I'm actually a soybean farmer'

Bessent's comment came during an interview with ABC News' "This Week," where he said…

items.title: Bessent Says TikTok Deal Finalized, Trump and Xi to Announce This Week
items.standfirst: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says the U.S. and China are set to announce a TikTok deal on Thursday.
items.content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says the U.S. and China are set to announce a TikTok deal on Thursday.

items.title: US and China reach ‘final deal’ on TikTok sale, treasury secretary says
items.standfirst: Scott Bessent said plan was part of framework for trade deal but did not share details on transferring app’s ownershipMurdoch, Ellison and China: what we know about the US’s TikTok dealUS treasury secretary Scott Bessent claimed on Sunday that the US and China have finalized the details of a deal transferring TikTok’s US version to new owners.“We reached a final deal on TikTok,” Bessent said on Sunday on CBS’s Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan. Alluding to Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, Bessent continued: “We reached [a deal] in Madrid, and I believe that as of today, all the details are ironed out, and that will be for the two leaders to consummate that transaction” during a meeting scheduled for Thursday in Korea. Continue reading...
items.content: Scott Bessent said plan was part of framework for trade deal but did not share details on transferring app’s ownershipMurdoch, Ellison and China: what we know about the US’s TikTok dealUS treasury secretary Scott Bessent claimed on Sunday that the US and China have finalized the details of a deal transferring TikTok’s US version to new owners.“We reached a final deal on TikTok,” Bessent said on Sunday on CBS’s Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan. Alluding to Donald Trump and his Chinese counterpart, Xi Jinping, Bessent continued: “We reached [a deal] in Madrid, and I believe that as of today, all the details are ironed out, and that will be for the two leaders to consummate that transaction” during a meeting scheduled for Thursday in Korea. Continue reading...

items.title: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries says healthcare premiums are "not locked in"
items.standfirst: As the government shutdown has stretched on with Democrats refusing to back any funding bill unless it extends ACA subsidies, open enrollment is set to begin on Nov. 1. But House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that the healthcare premiums are "not locked in," suggesting that open enrollment could be extended or Congress could intervene.
items.content: As the government shutdown has stretched on with Democrats refusing to back any funding bill unless it extends ACA subsidies, open enrollment is set to begin on Nov. 1. But House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that the healthcare premiums are "not locked in," suggesting that open enrollment could be extended or Congress could intervene.

items.title: TikTok deal to be finalized Thursday, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says
items.standfirst: With President Trump and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on a trip to Asia, Bessent told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that the TikTok deal will be finalized by Thursday. Bessent also said additional 100% tariffs with China are "effectively off the table" after the two-day meeting.
items.content: With President Trump and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on a trip to Asia, Bessent told "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that the TikTok deal will be finalized by Thursday. Bessent also said additional 100% tariffs with China are "effectively off the table" after the two-day meeting.

Why it matters: China has cut off purchases of U.S. soybeans amid the trade war, depriving farmers of their…

items.title: US and China agree framework of trade deal ahead of Trump-Xi meeting

Scott Bessent told the BBC's US news partner CBS…

items.title: US and China agree on trade framework for rare earths, soybeans
items.standfirst: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Sunday signalled that Washington and Beijing had reached a tentative trade framework that would see China delaying export curbs on rare earths and buying more US soybeans. If confirmed, the agreement would avert a threatened 100 percent hike on tariffs on Chinese exports.
items.content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent on Sunday signalled that Washington and Beijing had reached a tentative trade framework that would see China delaying export curbs on rare earths and buying more US soybeans. If confirmed, the agreement would avert a threatened 100 percent hike on tariffs on Chinese exports.

items.title: Mystery donor gives $130m to US military to pay troops during shutdown
items.standfirst: The Treasury Secretary says the US has enough for the next military payday, but can't pay service members after that.
items.content: The Treasury Secretary says the US has enough for the next military payday, but can't pay service members after that.

ai_summary: Treasury Secretary Bessent discussed Chinese tariffs and the TikTok deal.
House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries discussed the government shutdown.
Senator Lindsey Graham was also interviewed on the program.
Bessent stated the U.S. may not pay military by November 15.
The U.S. and China are ready to move forward on a TikTok deal.

clusters.title: Trump raises tariffs on Canadian goods over Reagan advert
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Raises Tariffs on Canada Over Anti-Tariff Ad
bullet_summary: Donald Trump has announced he will be raising tariffs on imports of Canadian goods by an extra 10% because of an anti-tariff advert aired in Ontario
Trump said that Ontario's premier didn't act quickly enough to pull the ad
Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad

items.content: Donald Trump has announced he will be raising tariffs on imports of Canadian goods by an extra 10% because of an anti-tariff advert aired in Ontario.

items.title: Trump threatens Canada with 10% extra import tax over anti-tariffs ad
items.standfirst: The ad, which used the words of former President Ronald Reagan to criticize U.S. tariffs, aired during a World Series game. Trump said that Ontario's premier didn't act quickly enough to pull the ad.
items.content: The ad, which used the words of former President Ronald Reagan to criticize U.S. tariffs, aired during a World Series game. Trump said that Ontario's premier didn't act quickly enough to pull the ad.(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)

items.title: Trump raises tariffs on Canada by 10% in retaliation for anti-tariff TV ad
items.standfirst: Move is response to ad sponsored by Ontario that referenced Ronald Reagan’s support for free tradeDonald Trump announced on Saturday that he will raise US tariffs on Canada by 10% in retaliation for an anti-tariff advertisement sponsored by the Ontario government, which has further strained one of the world’s largest trade partnerships.The statement, posted on the US president’s Truth Social account, came after several days of public disputes over the ad, which referenced Ronald Reagan’s support for free trade and provoked the US president’s anger. Continue reading...
items.content: Move is response to ad sponsored by Ontario that referenced Ronald Reagan’s support for free tradeDonald Trump announced on Saturday that he will raise US tariffs on Canada by 10% in retaliation for an anti-tariff advertisement sponsored by the Ontario government, which has further strained one of the world’s largest trade partnerships.The statement, posted on the US president’s Truth Social account, came after several days of public disputes over the ad, which referenced Ronald Reagan’s support for free trade and provoked the US president’s anger. Continue reading...

items.title: Canada to pull tariff ad featuring Reagan
items.standfirst: Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.
items.content: Canada announced it will stop airing an ad featuring former President Reagan criticizing tariffs, after President Trump said he would cut off trade talks over the ad. NBC News’ Kelly O’Donnell reports.

items.title: US and Canada spar over ad of Reagan denouncing tariffs that led to derailed trade talks
items.standfirst: Ontario premier says he plans to run ad featuring speech that sparked Trump’s ire again during World Series but campaign will end MondayAfter the US suspended all trade negotiations with Canada over a 1987 speech by Ronald Reagan denouncing tariffs that appeared to spark Donald Trump’s ire, the premier of Ontario said he planned to run an ad featuring the speech again during the World Series on Friday.Doug Ford, whose government ran the Reagan ad in US markets this week, first posted on X that the two nations were “stronger together”, while Trump added his own string of social media posts trumpeting the supposed benefits of tariffs. Continue reading...
items.content: Ontario premier says he plans to run ad featuring speech that sparked Trump’s ire again during World Series but campaign will end MondayAfter the US suspended all trade negotiations with Canada over a 1987 speech by Ronald Reagan denouncing tariffs that appeared to spark Donald Trump’s ire, the premier of Ontario said he planned to run an ad featuring the speech again during the World Series on Friday.Doug Ford, whose government ran the Reagan ad in US markets this week, first posted on X that the two nations were “stronger together”, while Trump added his own string of social media posts trumpeting the supposed benefits of tariffs. Continue reading...

items.title: One killed and six injured after shooting at Pennsylvania’s Lincoln University
items.standfirst: One armed person detained as historically Black school shooting comes amid rising violence at homecoming eventsAt least one person was killed and six others wounded in a shooting at Lincoln University in Pennsylvania late on Saturday, as students and alumni celebrated homecoming at outdoor festivities at the historically Black university, authorities said.A person who had a firearm was detained, and officials are investigating the possibility that there was more than one shooter but don’t believe there is any active threat to the campus, Chester county’s district attorney, Christopher de Barrena-Sarobe, said during a brief news conference early on Sunday. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) on Sunday said that it had taken control of the city of El-Fasher, the last major urban centre in western Darfur still outside its control. Local pro-army fighters accused the RSF of running a "media disinformation campaign" and insisted that residents were still fighting the paramilitary group.
items.content: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) on Sunday said that it had taken control of the city of El-Fasher, the last major urban centre in western Darfur still outside its control. Local pro-army fighters accused the RSF of running a "media disinformation campaign" and insisted that residents were still fighting the paramilitary group.

items.title: RSF claims capture of the Sudanese army’s last major stronghold in Darfur
items.standfirst: The paramilitary Rapid Support Forces say it's captured the Sudanese army's headquarters in the city of el-Fasher.
items.content: The paramilitary Rapid Support Forces say it's captured the Sudanese army's headquarters in the city of el-Fasher.

ai_summary: The Rapid Support Forces claimed control of El-Fasher.
El-Fasher is the last major urban center outside RSF control.
Local pro-army fighters accused the RSF of disinformation.
Local fighters insisted residents were still fighting.
The RSF claims to have captured the Sudanese army's headquarters.

clusters.title: Russia says it has tested nuclear-powered Burevestnik missile
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia Tests Nuclear-Powered Burevestnik Missile
bullet_summary: Russia has tested a new nuclear-powered cruise missile with an unlimited range, the country's top general said
Reported by BBC World, Sky News World

items.title: Russia says it has tested nuclear-powered Burevestnik missile
items.standfirst: The experimental weapon is hailed as having a potentially unlimited range - though Western experts have questioned its value.
items.content: The experimental weapon is hailed as having a potentially unlimited range - though Western experts have questioned its value.

items.title: Putin tests new 'invincible' nuclear-powered missile
items.standfirst: Russia has tested a new nuclear-powered cruise missile with an unlimited range, the country's top general said.

clusters.title: Left-winger Catherine Connolly wins Irish presidency
clusters.neutral_headline: Catherine Connolly Wins Irish Presidential Election
bullet_summary: Connolly, 68, said Saturday evening at Dublin Castle that she would champion diversity and be a voice for peace and one that “builds on our policy of neutrality
Reported by France24, BBC World

items.title: Left-winger Catherine Connolly wins Irish presidency
items.standfirst: Left-wing independent Catherine Connolly, who secured the backing of Ireland's left-leaning parties including Sinn Féin, has won the country's presidential election in a landslide victory against her centre-right rival. Connolly, 68, said Saturday evening at Dublin Castle that she would champion diversity and be a voice for peace and one that “builds on our policy of neutrality.”
items.content: Left-wing independent Catherine Connolly, who secured the backing of Ireland's left-leaning parties including Sinn Féin, has won the country's presidential election in a landslide victory against her centre-right rival. Connolly, 68, said Saturday evening at Dublin Castle that she would champion diversity and be a voice for peace and one that “builds on our policy of neutrality.”

items.title: Connolly declared president of Ireland after landslide win
items.standfirst: Catherine Connolly, an independent who was backed by the major left-wing parties, pledges to be "an inclusive president for all".
items.content: Catherine Connolly, an independent who was backed by the major left-wing parties, pledges to be "an inclusive president for all".

ai_summary: Catherine Connolly won the Irish presidential election.
Connolly is an independent candidate.
She was backed by left-leaning parties, including Sinn Féin.
Connolly pledged to champion diversity.
She will be a voice for peace and neutrality.

clusters.title: Trump may have another motive in extreme escalation of war on drugs
clusters.neutral_headline: US Sends Aircraft Carrier to Caribbean Region
bullet_summary: The Trump administration announced it will send an aircraft carrier towards Latin America in a major escalation of its war on drug cartels
Reported by Sky News World, NBC World

items.title: Trump may have another motive in extreme escalation of war on drugs
items.standfirst: The world's largest aircraft carrier is steaming towards the Caribbean supported by the rest of its "carrier group" to add even more muscle to the US forces already threateningly close to Venezuela.
items.content: The world's largest aircraft carrier is steaming towards the Caribbean supported by the rest of its "carrier group" to add even more muscle to the US forces already threateningly close to Venezuela.

items.title: U.S to send aircraft carrier to Caribbean
items.standfirst: The Trump administration announced it will send an aircraft carrier towards Latin America in a major escalation of its war on drug cartels. NBC News’ Courtney Kube reports.
items.content: The Trump administration announced it will send an aircraft carrier towards Latin America in a major escalation of its war on drug cartels. NBC News’ Courtney Kube reports.

ai_summary: The United States will send an aircraft carrier to the Caribbean.
The carrier is supported by its carrier group.
The move is an escalation of the war on drug cartels.
The aircraft carrier is heading towards Venezuela.
The US forces are already close to Venezuela.

clusters.title: US imposes sanctions on left-wing Colombian President Petro
clusters.neutral_headline: US Imposes Sanctions on Colombian President Petro
bullet_summary: Reported by BBC World, Guardian World

items.title: US imposes sanctions on left-wing Colombian President Petro
items.standfirst: Washington has accused Gustavo Petro of allowing drug cartels to flourish during his time in office.
items.content: Washington has accused Gustavo Petro of allowing drug cartels to flourish during his time in office.

items.title: US places sanctions on Colombian president over alleged failure to stop cartels
items.standfirst: Treasury accuses Gustavo Petro of ‘allowing drug cartels to flourish’ as president attacks Trump’s ‘oppressive regime’The US treasury department has announced sanctions on Colombian president Gustavo Petro, one of Donald Trump’s harshest international critics.“President Petro has allowed drug cartels to flourish and refused to stop this activity,” treasury secretary Scott Bessent wrote in a post on X. “Today President Trump is taking strong action to protect our nation.” Continue reading...
items.content: Treasury accuses Gustavo Petro of ‘allowing drug cartels to flourish’ as president attacks Trump’s ‘oppressive regime’The US treasury department has announced sanctions on Colombian president Gustavo Petro, one of Donald Trump’s harshest international critics.“President Petro has allowed drug cartels to flourish and refused to stop this activity,” treasury secretary Scott Bessent wrote in a post on X. “Today President Trump is taking strong action to protect our nation.” Continue reading...

ai_summary: The United States imposed sanctions on Colombian President Petro.
Washington accused Petro of allowing drug cartels to flourish.
The US Treasury announced the sanctions.
President Trump is taking strong action.
Petro is one of Trump's harshest international critics.
